definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
category/genus (taxonomy)/family members/dependents/to belong to/subordinate to/affiliated with/be born in the year of (one of the 12 animals)/to be/to prove to be/to constitute
to join together/to fix one's attention on/to concentrate on

sentences.english: Many of Meteor Shower's ads fall in that category.
sentences.chinese: 《流星雨》中的很多廣告就分屬此類。

sentences.english: She found that those who achieve extreme longevity tend to fall into three categories.
sentences.chinese: 她發現特別長壽的人傾向於分屬三類。

sentences.english: They're also classified separately on your financial statements 4.
sentences.chinese: 他們也在你的財務決算中分屬不同的類別。

sentences.english: The Sino-South Korean two languages belong to the different language type, the grammar difference is large.
sentences.chinese: 韓中兩種語言分屬不同的語言種類，語法差異較大。
